    • Field Detail

      • regenerateDepth

        public int regenerateDepth
        When generating a product, @regenerateDepth determines how deeply also inputs will be regenerated.

      • copies

        protected List<Path> copies

      • links

        protected List<Path> links

      • move

        protected Path move

      • EXISTS

        public static final int EXISTS
        Checks existence of product (used with @MEMORY or @FILE) Returns immediately, if a non-empty product instance is found. If an empty product is found, waits for completion.

      • DELETE

        public static final int DELETE
        Delete the product file on disk (future option: also in memory cache).

      • INPUTLIST

        public static final int INPUTLIST
        Retrieve input list.

      • GENERATE

        public static final int GENERATE
        The product is (re)generated. Used with MEMORY and FILE

      • MAKE

        public static final int MAKE
        Conditional generate: create product only if it does not exist. Used with MEMORY and FILE In program flow, MEMORY and FILE will be checked first, and only if they fail, GENERATION takes place.

      • RUN

        public static final int RUN
        Run script "run.sh" in the product directory (after)

      • STATUS

        public static final int STATUS
        Go through product request handler checking existence of product generator, memory cache and output directory.

      • PARALLEL

        public static final int PARALLEL

      • CLEAR_CACHE

        public static final int CLEAR_CACHE

      • MEMORY

        public static final int MEMORY
        The product is in memory cache

      • FILE

        public static final int FILE
        Product should be saved on disk. System side generator may save it anyway. â€“ return immediately in success

      • REDIRECT

        public static final int REDIRECT
        HTTP only: client will be redirected to URL of generated product Strictly speaking - needs no file, but a result (file or object).
        See Also:
        Nutlet.doGet(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)

      • STREAM

        public static final int STREAM
        Output in a stream (Currently, HTTP only. Future option: standard output.)
        See Also:
        Nutlet.doGet(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)

      • SHORTCUT

        public static final int SHORTCUT
        Link file to short directory
